description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9e08l","text":"This protocol describes the collection, processing, and cryopreservation of pediatric adenoid and tonsil samples for downstream single-cell analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2labj","text":"This is an experimental protocol for the processing of adenoid and tonsil samples collected from children. Sample collection must have and be compliant with Human Ethics Committee approval.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: Human TruStain FcX™ (Fc Receptor Blocking Solution)

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: COLLECTION OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cd1k5","text":"Prepare specimen containers for adenoid and tonsil samples by adding 10mL pre-chilled RPMI supplemented with 2% heat-inactivated fetal calf serum (referred to as RPMI 2% FCS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: COLLECTION OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ius0","text":"After obtaining informed consent from family and/or patient, collect adenoids/tonsils at the time of clinically indicated tonsillectomy/adenoidectomy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cqko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enphh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vmcl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fl5go","text":"For guidelines on how to safely collect tonsil/adenoid tissue from children, please see:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ejrin","text":" ","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"285eg","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"align":"","authors":"Mitchell RB, Archer SM, Ishman SL, Rosenfeld RM, Coles S, Finestone SA, Friedman NR, Giordano T, Hildrew DM, Kim TW, Lloyd RM, Parikh SR, Shulman ST, Walner DL, Walsh SA, Nnacheta LC","can_edit":true,"created_on":"","date":1548979200,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1177/0194599818807917","guid":"637F58CA74BB43DF83D4F7D20D0A844D","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_guid":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Clinical Practice Guideline: Tonsillectomy in Children (Update)-Executive Summary."},"mutability":"IMMUTABLE","type":"citation"}}}}}}

steps.section: COLLECTION OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ajhs","text":"Adenoid and tonsil samples must be placed on ice and processed in the laboratory within   to   of the procedure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":93,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"92emj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4e6lo","text":"Place the tissue in a glass cell culture plate with 10mL RPMI 2% FCS. Remove any visible blood clots, fat, and connective tissues with forceps and scissors/scalpel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ua7j","text":"Transfer the trimmed adenoid/tonsil tissue to a new glass cell culture plate containing 10mL RPMI 2% FCS. Mince the tissue into a fine paste using scissors or a scalpel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3drar","text":"Muddle the tissue using a plunger from a sterile syringe to dissociate the cells from the tissue, then filter the cell suspension through a 100µm cell strainer into a 50mL tube.  Centrifuge the cell suspension   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":210,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7sveh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dnhu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fqg0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bnfrv","text":"Cell isolation can also be done using a gentleMACS tissue dissociator","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"68mv3","text":"Remove the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in 8mL RPMI 2% FCS.  Fill a 15mL tube with 2mL of Ficoll plaque plus and layer the adenoid/tonsil cell suspension onto the surface of the Ficoll solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0vij","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbqpp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ts54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"blar5","text":"Layer the cell suspension slowly to prevent the Ficoll solution from mixing with the cells. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2u3n8","text":"Centrifuge the layered cell suspension at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":1800,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"4 Acceleration and NO brake ","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fotj4","text":"Once the spin is complete, carefully aspirate the mononuclear layer at the interface between the RPMI 2% FCS and the Ficoll solution into a new 15mL tube. Top up the cell suspension to 10mL with RPMI 2% FCS and centrifuge   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":222,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9cb3c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r0gq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fndgh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5p2du","text":"When collecting the cells, try to avoid Ficoll solution as much as possible.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"est1g","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in 3 mL RPMI 2% FCS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7acpl","text":"Prepare cell suspension for cell counting. Here, we use AO/PI and the LUNA FL counter. Dilute cell suspension in a microcentrifuge tube in RPMI 2% FCS at a ratio of 1:10 for adenoids and 1:100 for tonsils.  Remove 18µL of diluted cells and place into a new microcentrifuge tube for cell counting. Add 2 µL of AO/PI to the count tube and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF ADENOID AND TONSIL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e9ior","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend cells at a ratio of 1:1 in RPMI 2% FCS and freeze solution (heat-inactivated FCS + 15% DMSO) such that cells are frozen between 1-20 million cells/mL. Transfer cells to cryogenic vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF ADENOID AND TONSIL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ad7l1","text":"Immediately place cryogenic vials into an isopropanol freezing container (e.g. Nalgene‱ Mr. Frosty) or Cool Cell (Corning) and transfer to   overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3B70EF87E65311EE92B00A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F4152E37E66D11EE92B00A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","name":":registered:","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF ADENOID AND TONSIL MONONUCLEAR CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ai5lp","text":"For long term storage, transfer the vials to liquid nitrogen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbi85","text":"Resuspend cell suspension for fixable viability staining according to manufacturers' instructions (e.g. the LIVE/DEAD‱ Fixable UV Blue Stain from Invitrogen/ThermoFisher). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1E9DB6E5E65411EE92B00A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6dl9d","text":"Load 10µL of stained cells onto a LUNA fluorescent counting slide and count. Record viability, total cell count, and live cell count. steps.section: PROCESSING OF ADENOID AND TONSIL TISSUE TO CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2due0","text":"If choosing to run flow cytometry or other single cell assays on fresh cells, here is where you can allocate the required number of cells for downstream processing. For flow cytometry, described below, we allocate 500,000 cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
